Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a land habitat, such as a playground, garden, forest, or parking lot, and show different types of living things found there.
The student can draw a water habitat, such as a pond, stream, or lake, and show different types of living things found there.
The student can illustrate different types of plants in the habitat, like trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants.
The student can illustrate different types of animals in the habitat, like lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can compare and show patterns of plant and animal diversity across the different habitats they draw.
The student can organize their drawing to clearly represent and label the different living things in each habitat.
